# Bayesian Logistic Regression

## WOE 1: Graduate School Admission


### Datengrundlage
Wir verwenden den Datensatz Graduate Schoole Admission aus dem {{< iconify fa-brands r-project >}}-Paket `{ProbBayes}`. Er wird dort wie folgt beschrieben:

:::{.callout-note collapse=false appearance='default' icon=false}
## Graduate Schoole Admission {{< iconify fa6-solid database >}}
A data frame with 400 observations on the following 3 variables.

* Admission: student was admitted (1) or not admitted (0)
* GRE: GRE score
* GPA: grade point average
:::

### Datenimport
```{r}
#| message: false
library(ProbBayes)
```


## Das Modell
$$
Admisson_i \sim \operatorname{Bernoulli}(\theta_i)
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
\operatorname{logit}(\theta_i) &= b_0 + b_1 \cdot GRE_i + b_2 \cdot GPA_i \\
\theta_i &= \operatorname{logit}^{-1}\left(b_0 + b_1 \cdot GRE_i + b_2 \cdot GPA_i\right) \\
\end{aligned}
$$
Wobei in R $\operatorname{logit}()$ `logit()` und  $\operatorname{logit}^{-1}() =$ `plogis()`. 

```{r}
library(ProbBayes)
library(brms)
library(tidyverse)
data(GradSchoolAdmission)
head(GradSchoolAdmission)

mod5 <- brm(Admission ~ scale(GRE) + scale(GPA), 
            data = GradSchoolAdmission,
            family = bernoulli())
summary(mod5)
pp_check(mod5)
pp_check(mod5, type = "bars")
conditional_effects(mod5)
```
